p: Turkish cabbage, B. orientalis L., is a biennial or perennial hemicryptophyte with allelopathic ability that enables rapid dominance and promotes the formation of dense patches. The numerous little flowers (petals are 5–8 mm long) are hermaphroditic and insect-pollinated, with self-fertile breeding system (Dietz et al. 1999). Plants reach up to 1.2 m height.
